macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Ends Week Marginally Up +0.1% Amid Four-Day Decline and Triple Witching Expiration
items.summary: The S&P 500 closed last week up 0.1% despite four consecutive down days ending Thursday with a 180-point drop, likely tied to triple witching options and futures expiration on Friday. Analysts predict potential new highs above 7,000 by year-end 2025 if no major geopolitical issues arise, with VIX dropping 11.62% on Friday signaling reduced volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Top 100 Crypto Tokens Show Mixed Performance on December 23
items.summary: Audiera (BEAT) surged 57.16% to $4.55, while MYX Finance gained 18.8%. Notable decliners included Canton (CC) dropping 15.79%, Aave falling 11.25% to $154.78, and Mantle declining 1.89%.

items.title: Bitcoin Rejected at $90K Again as Gold Correlation Turns Negative
items.summary: Bitcoin failed to break above $90,000 on December 22, slipping back to the $88,000 range. Bitcoin's correlation with gold has turned negative, indicating the market is treating BTC more as a high-beta risk asset rather than a macro hedge.

items.title: SEC Charges Crypto Trading Platforms and Investment Clubs in $14 Million Fraud Scheme
items.summary: The SEC filed charges against Morocoin Tech Corp., Berge Blockchain Technology, and Cirkor Inc., along with four investment clubs, for defrauding retail investors of over $14 million through a social media-based confidence scam involving fake AI investment tips.

items.title: Analyst Raises Hut 8 Price Target Following Billion-Dollar AI Infrastructure Deal
items.summary: Benchmark analyst Mark Palmer upgraded Hut 8's price target after the Bitcoin mining company announced a partnership with Anthropic and Fluidstack to develop up to 2,295 megawatts of AI data center capacity, backed by Google's financial guarantee. Hut 8 stock is up 17.78% and has climbed 138% year-to-date.

items.title: JPMorgan Exploring Cryptocurrency Trading for Institutional Clients
items.summary: JPMorgan Chase is considering offering cryptocurrency trading services to its institutional clients, signaling continued mainstream adoption of digital assets by major financial institutions.

items.title: 2025 Marked Year of Crypto Institutionalization with Major Policy Changes
items.summary: 2025 cemented digital assets in mainstream finance through U.S. policy developments including the repeal of SAB 121, allowing banks to treat crypto assets like traditional assets. BitGo launched Stablecoin-as-a-Service in March, and World Liberty Financial created USD1 in April as a regulated institutional settlement solution.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Acknowledges Persistent Prompt Injection Vulnerabilities in AI Browsers
items.summary: OpenAI states that AI browsers may always be vulnerable to prompt injection attacks and is developing an LLM-based automated attacker using reinforcement learning to simulate and test defenses proactively. The company emphasizes layered defenses, rapid patching, and internal stress-testing to stay ahead of real-world exploits.

items.title: KAIST Researchers Unveil AI-Driven Assistant for Optimizing Injection Molding
items.summary: KAIST has proposed an AI-based solution that autonomously calculates optimal injection molding settings, optimizes manufacturing processes, and transfers knowledge to address efficiency concerns.

items.title: Archetype Begins Beta Testing AI Agent Toolkit for Physical Machine Environments
items.summary: Archetype is beta testing a toolkit designed for building AI agents that can be embedded directly into IT environments to manage machines in physical settings.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Vince Zampella, Co-Creator of Call of Duty, Dies in Car Crash at 57
items.summary: Vince Zampella, co-founder of Infinity Ward and Respawn Entertainment, known for Call of Duty, Titanfall, Apex Legends, and Star Wars Jedi games, died in a Ferrari crash north of Los Angeles on Sunday. Tributes highlight his profound impact on the FPS genre and gaming industry.

items.title: Vince Zampella Killed in Single-Car Crash Near Los Angeles
items.summary: The influential game developer and Respawn CEO, behind blockbuster franchises like Call of Duty and Apex Legends, passed away at 57 in a crash involving his Ferrari, as reported by US media.

items.title: Fantastic Pixel Castle Studio Closes After Funding Cut
items.summary: Greg Street's MMO studio, Fantastic Pixel Castle, shut down as of November after NetEase withdrew funding, marking another blow amid ongoing industry layoffs.

items.title: Larian Faces Backlash Over Divinity 3 Reveal and AI Use
items.summary: Larian Studios received heated feedback after revealing Divinity 3, with concerns over a trailer and CEO Swen's comments on AI tools; the studio plans an AMA post-holiday to address issues.

items.title: Major Game Releases This Week: Duet Night Abyss, Game of Fate 3
items.summary: Upcoming PC releases include Duet Night Abyss (Dec 23), a fantasy action RPG; Quarantine Zombiesl and others (Dec 23-24); and Game of Fate 3: Clash of Crowns (Dec 25), a live-action thriller.

items.title: EVE Online Sees Record Destruction in November 2025
items.summary: EVE Online reported nearly 730K hulls, capsules, and structures destroyed in November, with 74.85 trillion ISK in losses, surpassing yearly peaks amid Drone Regions glassing.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: FINNY AI Raises $17 Million in Series A Funding
items.summary: FINNY AI, a prospecting and marketing platform for financial advisors, secured $17 million in Series A funding led by Venrock, with participation from investors including former Vanguard CEO William McNabb. The funding supports growth in the wealthtech sector.

items.title: CapIntel Reports 9,225% Revenue Growth and Launches New Products
items.summary: CapIntel announced exceptional growth with 9,225% revenue increase over three years, alongside launches of AI Statement Reader for data analysis and beta digital presentations for personalized client communications. The company expanded its leadership team and gained global recognition.

items.title: Tradeweb Completes First Fully Electronic Auction for Brokered CDs
items.summary: Tradeweb Markets executed the industry's first fully electronic auction for brokered certificates of deposit on its retail platform, involving Gateway First Bank and InspereX, powered by Alphaledger’s blockchain technology.

items.title: Artrya Secures Third U.S. Commercial Customer with Cone Health
items.summary: ASX-listed Artrya signed a five-year deal worth at least US$0.45 million with Cone Health for its Salix Coronary Anatomy platform, converting all three U.S. foundation partners to commercial customers and boosting shares 6%.

items.title: iRobot Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy After Failed Amazon Acquisition
items.summary: iRobot entered bankruptcy in December 2025 with revenue declines, following the FTC-blocked $1.4 billion Amazon deal in 2024, and was acquired by contract manufacturer Picea Robotics amid regulatory and competitive pressures.

items.title: Israeli High-Tech Funding Reaches $15.6 Billion in 2025
items.summary: Israeli high-tech companies raised $15.6 billion in private funding this year, a rise from $12.2 billion in 2024, according to Startup Nation Central's report.
